A search at npmjs shows this one:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/ieee754 <- most popular, but only up to 53 bits
https://www.npmjs.com/package/ieee-float <- up to 64 bits

ieee754 = require('ieee754')

```js
9007199254740993 // 53 bit number overflow
// outputs: 9007199254740992

fp = require('ieee-float')
output = []
fp.writeDoubleBE(output, '9007199254740993.5')
fp.readDoubleBE(output)
// output: 9007199254740994  https://github.com/andrasq/node-ieee-float/issues/1
```

big.js, bignumber.js and decimal.js
https://github.com/MikeMcl/big.js/wiki


https://forums.eosgo.io/discussion/374/understand-softfloat

ecc.recover('EOSK5yY5ehsnDMc6xcRhsLYzFuZGUaKwb4hc8oLmP5HA1EhU42NRo3ygx3zvLRJ1nkw1NA5nCSegwcYkSfkZBQBzqMDsCGnNK', '00'.repeat(32) + '', 'hex')
